titles.title: Providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 91) providing amounts for the expenses of certain committees of the House of Representatives in the One Hundred Fifth Congress.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-41, by Mr. Dreier.
Rule provides for consideration of H. Res. 91 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 13.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.

During the course of debate, Mr. Barr demanded that certain words of Mr. Doggett be taken down. The Clerk reported the words in question to the House. Subsequently, Mr. Doggett asked unanimous consent to withdraw the words in question and without objection, the words were stricken from the record.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 218 - 179 (Roll no. 69).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/20/1997--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (closed) for the consideration of H.Res. 91 (House committee funding).
